item.title: James add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "There's no such thing as perfect writing, just like there's no such thing as perfect despair." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: James add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description:
"The truth about the world, he said, is that anything is possible. Had you not seen it all from birth and thereby bled it of its strangeness it would appear to you for what it is, a hat trick in a medicine show, a fevered dream, a trance bepopulate with chimeras having neither analogue nor precedent, an itinerant carnival, a migratory tentshow whose ultimate destination after many a pitch in many a mudded field is unspeakable and calamitous beyond reckoning.
The universe is no narrow thing and the order within it is not constrained by any latitude in its conception to repeat what exists in one part in any other part. Even in this world more things exist without our knowledge than with it and the order in creation which you see is that which you have put there, like a string in a maze, so that you shall not lose your way. For existence has its own order and that no man's mind can compass, that mind itself being but a fact among others." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: James add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: James add a quote by Richard P. Feynman
item.description: "We are at the very beginning of time for the human race. It is not unreasonable that we grapple with problems. But there are tens of thousands of years in the future. Our responsibility is to do what we can, learn what we can, improve the solutions, and pass them on." -- Richard P. Feynman

item.title: James add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "Since, in the long run, every planetary civilization will be endangered by impacts from space, every surviving civilization is obliged to become spacefaring--not because of exploratory or romantic zeal, but for the most practical reason imaginable: staying alive... If our long-term survival is at stake, we have a basic responsibility to our species to venture to other worlds." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: James add a quote by Larry Niven
item.description: "The dinosaurs became extinct because they didn't have a space program. And if we become extinct because we don't have a space program, it'll serve us right!" -- Larry Niven

item.title: James add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "A good bookshop is just a genteel Black Hole that knows how to read." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: James add a quote by Niels Bohr
item.description: "The very nature of the quantum theory ... forces us to regard the space-time coordination and the claim of causality, the union of which characterizes the classical theories, as complementary but exclusive features of the description, symbolizing the idealization of observation and description, respectively." -- Niels Bohr

item.title: James add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Because we have for millenia made moral, aesthetic, religious demands on the world, looked upon it with blind desire, passion or fear, and abandoned ourselves to the bad habits of illogical thinking, this world has gradually become so marvelously variegated, frightful, meaningful, soulful, it has acquired color - but we have been the colorists: it is the human intellect that has made appearances appear and transported its erroneous basic conceptions into things." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: James add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description:
"It's been suggested that if the super-naturalists really had the powers they claim, they'd win the lottery every week. I prefer to point out that they could also win a Nobel Prize for discovering fundamental physical forces hitherto unknown to science. Either way, why are they wasting their talents doing party turns on television?
By all means let's be open-minded, but not so open-minded that our brains drop out." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: James add a quote by Daisaku Ikeda
item.description: "Buddhism holds that everything is in constant flux. Thus the question is whether we are to accept change passively and be swept away by it or whether we are to take the lead and create positive changes on our own initiative. While conservatism and self-protection might be likened to winter, night, and death, the spirit of pioneering and attempting to realize ideals evokes images of spring, morning, and birth." -- Daisaku Ikeda

item.title: James add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "You only lose what you cling to." -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: James add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "In the haunted house of life, art is the only stair that doesn't creak." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: James add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "It's been a prevalent notion. Fallen sparks. Fragments of vessels broken at the Creation. And someday, somehow, before the end, a gathering back to home. A messenger from the Kingdom, arriving at the last moment. But I tell you there is no such message, no such home -- only the millions of last moments . . . nothing more. Our history is an aggregate of last moments." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: James add a quote by Saul Williams
item.description: "the greatest Americans have not been born yet they are waiting patiently for the past to die" -- Saul Williams

item.title: James add a quote by Octavia E. Butler
item.description: "I just knew there were stories I wanted to tell." -- Octavia E. Butler

item.title: James add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "A thing is mighty big when time and distance cannot shrink it." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: James add a quote by Marie Curie
item.description: "Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less." -- Marie Curie

item.title: James add a quote by Tom Bissell
item.description: "A great writer reveals the truth even when he or she does not wish to." -- Tom Bissell

item.title: James add a quote by Aleister Crowley
item.description: "One would go mad if one took the Bible seriously; but to take it seriously one must be already mad." -- Aleister Crowley

item.title: James add a quote by Niels Bohr
item.description: "Prediction is very difficult, especially about the future." -- Niels Bohr

item.title: James add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "What's a philosopher?' said Brutha. Someone who's bright enough to find a job with no heavy lifting,' said a voice in his head." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: James add a quote by Marshall McLuhan
item.description: "I don't necessarily agree with everything that I say." -- Marshall McLuhan

item.title: James add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "Excess on occasion is exhilarating. It prevents moderation from acquiring the deadening effect of a habit." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: James add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "Life is a long lesson in humility." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: James add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: James add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: James add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: James add a quote by Sean Carroll
item.description: "The world is not magic — and that’s the most magical thing about it." -- Sean Carroll

item.title: James add a quote by Alfred Tennyson
item.description: "I am a part of all that I have met." -- Alfred Tennyson
